bibl.title: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 25, 1952

div1.p: Siler informs Hench that the Walter Reed Memorial Association has authorized funds for a wreath to be placed at Reed's medallion while the Surgeon General commissioned a wreath for Finlay.

div1.head: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 25, 1952
div1.opener:
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
-----
GORGAS MEMORIAL LABORATORY
November 25, 1952
JOSEPH F. SILER
PRESIDENT
MAURICE H. THATCHER
VICE PRESIDENT AND GENERAL COUNSEL
WALTER A. BLOEDORN
SECRETARY
EXECUTIVE OFFICES
1835 EYE STREET, NORTHWEST
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
This will acknowledge receipt of your letter of November 19th
relative to the dedication ceremonies at Havana, Cuba on December 3rd.

It was a very great pleasure to learn from General Armstrong that
General Streit was to go down to Havana to the dedication ceremonies. Yes-
terday I had a talk with General Streit relative to his trip and I am very
glad to be able to advise you that the Walter Reed Memorial Association has
authorized the expenditure of $15.00 for a wreath to be placed beneath the
medallion of Walter Reed at the dedication ceremonies. The Surgeon General
of the Army is authorizing that a wreath be placed beneath the medallion
of Dr. Finlay. In view of this fact we felt that it would be all right to
have the wreath from the Walter Reed Memorial Association placed beneath the
medallion of Major Reed.

General Streit advises me he is leaving here on December 2nd by plane
and will return on December 4th.

I am very glad to be able to say that Dr. Nogueira was good enough
to have one of the official programs sent to me and we have placed it in the
files of the Walter Reed Memorial Association.

I am delighted that it will be possible for you to attend these
ceremonies and very much regret that I cannot go down myself.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, J. F. Siler
Col., (MC), USA, Rtd.
President, Walter Reed Memorial
